===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|がん|きょう}}

{{IPAchar|/gankjau/}} → {{IPAchar|/gankjɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/gankjoː/}}

Probably a borrowing from written {{der|ja|zh|sort=かんきょう'|眼鏡}}.  Eyeglasses are first mentioned in Chinese in the 1400s as {{m|zh|靉靆|tr=aidai?}}, a transcription of an {{cog|ar|-}} term.  By the late {{w|Ming dynasty}}, eyeglasses appear in writing as {{lang|zh|靉靆即眼鏡}} (“''aidai'', i.e. eye-lenses”), using the compound term {{m|zh|眼鏡|lit=eye + lens}}.

Compare modern {{cog|nan|-}} reading ''gán-kiàⁿ''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|がんきょう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|がんきょう|hhira=がんきやう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かんきょう'|military|possibly|_|archaic}} [[glasses]], [[eyeglasses]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading was mostly used by the military.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  May be somewhat archaic now.

==Okinawan==

===Etymology 1===
Cognate with mainland {{cog|ja|眼鏡|tr=gankyō||eyeglasses}}, ultimately deriving from written {{der|ryu|zh|sort=かんちょお'|眼鏡}}. Eyeglasses are first mentioned in Chinese in the 1400s as {{m|zh|靉靆|tr=aidai?}}, a transcription of an {{etyl|ar|-}} term.  By the late {{w|Ming dynasty}}, eyeglasses appear in writing as {{lang|zh|靉靆即眼鏡}} (“''aidai'', i.e. eye-lenses”), using the compound term {{m|zh|眼鏡|lit=eye + lens}}.
